verses.text: Manasseh \add was\add* twelve years old when he \add began\add* to reign, and he reigned fifty and five years in Jerusalem:
but did \add that\add* which \add was\add* evil in the sight of the \sc Lord\sc*, like unto the abominations of the heathen, whom the \sc Lord\sc* had cast out before the children of Israel.
For he built again the high places which Hezekiah his father had broken down, and he reared up altars for Baalim, and made groves, and worshipped all the host of heaven, and served them.
Also he built altars in the house of the \sc Lord\sc*, whereof the \sc Lord\sc* had said, In Jerusalem shall my name be for ever.
And he built altars for all the host of heaven in the two courts of the house of the \sc Lord\sc*.

And he caused his children to pass through the fire in the valley of the son of Hinnom: also he observed times, and used enchantments, and used witchcraft, and dealt with a familiar spirit, and with wizards: he wrought much evil in the sight of the \sc Lord\sc*, to provoke him to anger.

And he set a carved image, the idol which he had made, in the house of God, of which God had said to David and to Solomon his son, In this house, and in Jerusalem, which I have chosen before all the tribes of Israel, will I put my name for ever:

neither will I any more remove the foot of Israel from out of the land which I have appointed for your fathers; so that they will take heed to do all that I have commanded them, according to the whole law and the statutes and the ordinances by the hand of Moses.
So Manasseh made Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem to err, \add and\add* to do worse than the heathen, whom the \sc Lord\sc* had destroyed before the children of Israel.
And the \sc Lord\sc* spake to Manasseh, and to his people: but they would not hearken.
Wherefore the \sc Lord\sc* brought upon them the captains of the host of the king of Assyria, which took Manasseh among the thorns, and bound him with fetters, and carried him to Babylon.
And when he was in affliction, he besought the \sc Lord\sc* his God, and humbled himself greatly before the God of his fathers,

and prayed unto him: and he was intreated of him, and heard his supplication, and brought him again \add to\add* Jerusalem into his kingdom. Then Manasseh knew that the \sc Lord\sc* he \add was\add* God.

Now after this he built a wall without the city of David, on the west \add side\add* of Gihon, in the valley, even to the entering in at the fish gate, and compassed about Ophel, and raised it up a very great height, and put captains of war in all the fenced cities of Judah.

And he took away the strange gods, and the idol out of the house of the \sc Lord\sc*, and all the altars that he had built in the mount of the house of the \sc Lord\sc*, and in Jerusalem, and cast \add them\add* out of the city.
And he repaired the altar of the \sc Lord\sc*, and sacrificed thereon peace offerings and thank offerings, and commanded Judah to serve the \sc Lord\sc* God of Israel.
Nevertheless the people did sacrifice still in the high places, \add yet\add* unto the \sc Lord\sc* their God only.

Now the rest of the acts of Manasseh, and his prayer unto his God, and the words of the seers that spake to him in the name of the \sc Lord\sc* God of Israel, behold, they \add are written\add* in the book of the kings of Israel.

His prayer also, and \add how God\add* was intreated of him, and all his sin, and his trespass, and the places wherein he built high places, and set up groves and graven images, before he was humbled: behold, they \add are\add* written among the sayings of the seers.
So Manasseh slept with his fathers, and they buried him \add in\add* his own house: and Amon his son reigned in his stead.
Amon \add was\add* two and twenty years old when he \add began\add* to reign, and reigned two years in Jerusalem.

But he did \add that\add* which \add was\add* evil in the sight of the \sc Lord\sc*, as did Manasseh his father: for Amon sacrificed unto all the carved images which Manasseh his father had made, and served them;
and humbled not himself before the \sc Lord\sc*, as Manasseh his father had humbled himself; but Amon trespassed more and more.
And his servants conspired against him, and slew him in his own house.
But the people of the land slew all them that had conspired against king Amon; and the people of the land made Josiah his son king in his stead.
